caption: Elizabeth's is amazing. Despite dinner being vegan/raw, this isn't the typical vegan deconstructive experience; Elizabeth's is a *constructivist* experience. Most vegan meals so start with a finished dish, remove the meat, and them try desperately to replace it. At Elizabeth's, they start with ingredients that just so happen not to include any meat or animal products, and construct amazing meals from them. A definite favorite to take any acquaintance to.
We loved Elizabeth's Gone Raw - the food, ambience, experience, and service were all amazing! We plan to go back!
First fine dining experience and it was incredible. Wonderful tastes I’ve never had before. Pricey but with it!

Elizabeth Gone Raw might be the most amazing vegan restaurant I have visited. I was really impressed by the presentation and taste of the food, ambience of the restaurant and attentive and friendly staff. I will definitely visit this restaurant again !!
Amazing!!

We had an unforgettable meal at Elizabeth's! The staff is knowledgable and dedicated and Elizabeth herself came to greet the tables. Decor was elegant yet welcoming. We felt very secure with the measures they put in place to prevent the spread of Covid19. The strictly vegan (and mostly raw) food and drinks were perfectly balanced and seasoned and incredibly creative, with stunning presentation! There were smoked cocktails, yummy kale chips, sweet stuffed pepper with garlic "cheese", Savoy cabbage with "caviar", beet ravioli, fresh sorbet palette cleanser, and a beautiful delicious dessert with seasonal fruit. We left feeling satiated but light, unlike how we normally would after a 6 course meal. I can't wait until our next visit!
Great service, but unfortunately, the food lacked flavor and was certainly overpriced.
Elizabeth's Gone Raw is the most amazing vegan restaurant. I would recommend it to anyone not just vegans. The plates are beautiful and creative. It is truly a wonderful experience.
This is the best vegan food experience I have had in the city. The service is wonderful and the food is not only beautiful but unlike anything I have ever had!!!
Each course was beautiful and flavorful! The wine pairing was delicious! I highly recommend this place!!

A fine dining vegan experience. Elizabeth’s Gone Raw has tasty and creative dishes accompanied by a quiet, relaxed atmosphere and attentive wait staff. I recommend this restaurant to vegans and non vegans alike!

I recently went raw vegan and have been looking for eating options in the area. I came across this restaurant and my best friend and I each did a to go order of their 4 course meal on July 11th. Everything was DELICIOUS! Each course was so flavorful and the dipping sauces were the highlight of our meal. We ate every last bite! I also really enjoyed the cheesecake. One of our courses was Shrimpish and the "shrimp" looked and smelled so authentic that we thought it was. Our compliments to the chef! We both said we want to return to actually eat in the restaurant and experience the fine dining.
Amazing experience! small plates, they have a fixed vegan menu to die for

I was really impressed by the quality of service and the friendly staff. The plating and presentation of the food was spectacular. I docked one star because most of the food was room temperature, though to be fair maybe that was intentional. The wine pairing was well worth the value and I would highly recommend.
Best meal experience - of my life! Honestly, hands down. The food was delicious, interesting, high-class, and the service was wonderful. Can't wait to go back!
A MUST experience
Good Food , Good Service
Great presentation. Great creativity but only some of the dishes hit the mark. I liked the hearts of palm vegan crab cake and the coffee potatoes. Dessert was pretty bad.

Overall it was an interesting culinary experience, but for that price I would expect the food to be tasty. The place is upscale and fancy looking but cozy and welcoming. The wine pairing was good. Too bad we didn't enjoy the food.  $$$ Food: 160$ Wine pairing: 120$ Tax: 34$ Minimum service fee: 56$ (20%) (Doesn't include waitress tip).
Amazing food. Wine pairing. Very expensive, but a full evening.

My husband and I went because we were excited to have a nice vegan dinner. We were not expecting that level of fine dining when we went. 😂 But we were more than pleasantly surprised.  The door is to the left of the sign. Upon entering we were received by a waiter who we gave our reservation to, we were early and opted to sit at the bar while we waited. They have a coat check, very helpful since it was freezing outside. At the bar, they have kale chips and delicious beverage options including some nonalcoholic options. Once our table was ready we made out way upstairs. The environment is wonderfully elegant. We enjoyed some of their tea selection instead of wine, worked very well for us. And the dining room was nice and quiet during our 6:30pm reservation. It got a lot more lively when we left around 8pm. The dining experience was excellent, the coordination of the servers upon delivery of the food and the calm professionalism of all the staff was perfect. It is a very nice gastric experience that I highly recommend people enjoy at least once.

If you're thinking about going to Elizabeth's, stop thinking and just go. Excellent food, excellent service, excellent drinks. Everything was delicious and unique. I had multiple ingredients I've never tried or even heard of. All of it was plated beautifully as well. The kale chips served with the meal are so good. We had two servings and got some to go as well! The music playing was really interesting as well, smooth indie to rock your taste buds to. Not what I'd expect for fine dining but it actually for the vibe perfectly. I also appreciated that most of the staff I saw (all but 2 people) were female. Most fine dining can feel like a bit of a boy's club but that is most definitely not the case here and is nice to see.

For vegetarians and vegans fixed menus are generally an experience which is sadly unavailable. Thankfully we have Elizabeth to close the gap. While not strictly raw, the offering at Elizabeth's delivers a plant-based fine dining enjoyable for both omnivores and herbivores. Every bite and sip is carefully considered and thoroughly delicious.
Just a little pretentious and expensive BUT definitely! worth it.  If you’re Vegan and in DC, go.

Dining at Elizabeth's was an enchanting experience! The moment my wife and I set foot in the restaurant it was as if we stepped into Europe. The attention to detail was on point and everything was orchestrated like a dance. With every course we couldn't wait to see what we would be served next. Exquisite!

EDIT: After our first experience, Elizabeth reached out to me, apologized, and invited us to come back. When we went back it was the experience we had hoped for. The staff was wonderful and again, the food was amazingly prepared (though it is a tasting menu so I'd still advise not to show up hungry). Definitely a great place for special occasions.  Original Review: The food was good but certainly not worth the price. Our waiter was rude on several occasions (going so far as to lecture me on my nut allergy (I'm not allergic to nuts)) and didn't know the menu very well. When asked for a drink recommendation he read us the entire cocktail list. When we left we immediately went to get dinner (that's actually how little food you get). The food you do get is amazingly prepared though so...

Excellent food and service. This restaurant an staff are definitely Michelin star level. It was nice to also have Elizabeth herself amongst the staff greeting and serving guests. This was a great experience.
Lovey dinner, very expensive but such a nice experience. Recommend with split wine pairing (slight pour).
Vegan or not the chef and team are doing some incredible things with food.

I only wished I had taken pictures of the plates. The food was good and the service was amazing.  I must admit that I was sceptical since I'm not vegan, but I was pleasantly surprised. The only negative is the small portions.

I'll start by saying that from what we saw from the check-in area of the restaurant looked nice. That's about the only nice thing I can say about this place. We planned a date night for Elizabeth's Gone Raw a couple of weeks ago. We made a reservation via Open Table and we were both excited about the reviews we read. We were called the day before to confirm the reservation, which we did. We drove from Ashburn to eat here(about an hour with some traffic). We parked and started walking to the front door at around 9:15 pm when saw my phone ringing. I missed the call but saw they left a voicemail. I listened to the voicemail as we were walking up the steps and it said we were late for our 9:00 pm reservation and that they needed to hear from us soon. I was under the assumption our reservation was at 9:30 so I thought we were early. We walked in and explained that I just received a voicemail but I thought the reservation was at 9:30 which is why we were late. Before I finished my sentence, the host said: "I'm so sorry but we closed our kitchen, but did you want to make a new reservation for next week?" I explained that I just got the voicemail as I was walking up the steps which said to contact them soon which we did seconds later by walking in. I also knew they were open until 10 and they take reservations at 9:30 pm and 10:00 pm via open table and asked why the kitchen would close before either of those times. He apologized again and said we cannot eat because the kitchen is closed. I expressed my frustration with that level of service and we both left. I never in my life walked into a restaurant in a big city on a Saturday night and were turned down service 40 minutes before they accept their last reservation and/or close! We both left furious that we just drove this far and took the night off only to be turned away. As I was outside, I snapped one photo of the building and a gentleman came out and apologized again but told me it was my fault because I was late for my reservation. I then snapped and explained again that they don't close for another 40 minutes and they accept reservations until 10 pm so why would the kitchen be closed?! He went back inside and as I was walking away the owner came out. She offered to serve us but at that point, I wanted nothing to do with that establishment. The owner seemed like a nice lady but why anyone in her restaurant would turn away any customers, especially with reservations, 40 minutes before they close is ridiculous. Again, we got a voicemail that said to contact them soon and we walked in seconds later. We then were immediately turned away and then told it was our fault by some other man. I understand arriving late for a reservation is our fault and if the restaurant was full because the table was given away, I would have accepted that but to be turned away because they just decided to close their kitchen is horrible. Needless to say, we will never return here which is sad because we were very excited to try it out. Beware if you want to visit this place that they might just close without telling you or anyone else.

This place is the best place I've ever eaten at! Since becoming vegan I have been craving a fine dinning vegan experience and boy did I found one at Elizabeth's gone raw. They offer a 7 course prefixed meal of heavenly delicious dishes that satisfy all your taste buds and leave you feel super light and fresh even when you are completely stuffed. The presentation of every dish is pure art and I also highly recommend to get wine pairings with your meal. I found some of the best wines I ever had there! The menu fully changes every month and one of our favorite traditions with my husband is to have a date night at Elizabeth's every time the menu changes. This place offers the best dishes I've ever tried. So so happy this unique place exists!
Great tasting menu that rotates. $80 per person for the tasting menu and another $60 for wine pairing.
This place is an orgasim in your mouth. LOVE!
An exceptional experience.  Food atmosphere staff all wonderful.  A must for our family anytime we are in the DC area.

I am a committed carnivore but willing to try anything once.  Elizabeth's Gone Raw (EGR) is a strictly vegan restaurant with a prix fixe menu.  I went there to celebrate the birthday of a friend who has gone vegan.  The food at Elizabeth's Gone Raw needs no high-minded justification.  It speaks for itself as an exquisite expression of the culinary arts -- varied, delicious, based on novel combinations of ingredients, and brilliantly composed in terms of color, texture, taste, and presentation.  The chef  produces truly memorable dishes by combining ingredients I would normally disdain.  Even if one is not in sympathy with veganism, this is about as good a dining experience as you will ever have.  The service at EGR is impeccable.  The ambience is elegant.  The sound level and table separation enable conversation.  This is cuisine to savor and a restaurant to treasure.

Incredible service and even more incredible food.  So many different and unique flavours and the wine pairing matched the quality of the meals perfectly. We had a wonderful time and this restaurant felt like such a special place.

Can’t say enough good things about this place!! Raw vegan seven course meal! Every dish was amazing. The staff was efficient and even the non alcoholic drinks were amazing. We went for our anniversary and they even brought out a card which was a nice touch !!! Highly recommend any chance you get... vegan or not you will be blown away.

This is by far the most enjoyable and rewarding dining experience of my life!  If you care about the planet, the animals and your health enough to let it determine your food choices, you owe it to yourself to have this experience.  Absolutely fabulous!
Just go ! Sit ! Eat !
My absolute favorite restaurant in DC
Excellent food.  Outstanding service.  Fabulous ambiance.
Great vegan options that appeal to non vegetarians. Great service and awesome cocktails
Perfect
Wonderful, fantastic, creative, a delight Back in DC and it's better than ever, if that's possible
Wonderful experience great tasting food, classy, menu changes every month.
Must try in D.C.

I went to Elizabeth's because the partner in my firm came to town, and is a vegetarian. Obviously, I am not, therefore didn't know vegan and vegetarian were not the same. Needless to say, I came into dinner with a lack of enthusiasm (because I'm not a vegetarian).  Upon entering you are at the bar, it is succinct and we'll curated, with a casual unassuming atmosphere. That ability to offer quality over quantity is an art Elizabeth's has mastered.  The hostess ushered us upstairs to the dining room where there is very little of the noise I expect from a restaurant. The sound of pleasant conversation was stifled by kitchen sounds, which made me more expectant of a unique experience.  Admittedly, I was hard sell on a meal that didn't involve a fish or beef dish, but our waitress was a good sport about it. Also, as the courses were presented, she described each dish with an infectious enthusiasm. And to be honest, everything (this is hard for me to say)EVERYTHING was just delightful. There was a soup (with lemongrass or wheat grass) that was delicious! A tempura stuffed with... I'm not sure (but I really enjoyed it).  By the end of the service I was completely sold on returning of my own accord. Elizabeth's has every aspect of restaurateuring down pat. A remarkable wait staff, inspired foods, and a relaxed atmosphere created a unique experience that was DC dining at its finest.  Every star was well deserved!
Fabulous place. Fine vegan dining. Food is exceptional atmosphere and service extraordinary.  We will definitely dine there whenever we are in town.
Amazingly flavorful vegan dining experience!
Fine food absolutely delicious, great service. A wonderful evening

A simple five-star scale is inadequate to capture the awe-inspiring, exquisite, and visionary meal that I enjoyed at Elizabeth’s Gone Raw this weekend.  Each dish was crafted with a kind of passion and vision that I have never before experienced; each course promised flavors and textures I have never before tasted. My friends and I, one vegetarian and two meat-eaters, were continually wowed by the dishes and I firmly believe that diners with an open mind, vegan or not, will be as impressed as we were by EGR. I recall reading in another review that EGR offers “art you can eat.” Each dish in June’s tasting menu was indeed its own unique piece of art from amuse to dessert; from vegetables, nuts, seeds, legumes and other “simple” or even “boring” ingredients in the eyes of some, true skill and imagination of the chef elevates them to something amazing. Each course is to be fully appreciated in tandem with the equally artful wine pairing by Dora, the restaurant’s sommelier who was both a knowledgeable and delightful presence throughout our meal. EGR’s art goes even beyond the food and touches every corner of the experience-- the candlelit, intimate atmosphere, the flowers, the decor, and the warmth and careful service of each and every member of the staff.  Elizabeth’s Gone Raw is a dining experience that is distinct and special in each and every bite and moment. To give it five stars, two thumbs up, and the highest recommendation just doesn’t feel like enough. Beyond my endorsement, I’ll let the June tasting menu and a photo of my favorite course speak for itself.
If you into this type of thing..great place cool owner.

This is one of the best meals I've had in my life! So inventive and delicately balanced. Don't miss the wine pairing, it's perfect and introduced us to new and delicious spirits. Less pricey than most of the other tasting menus in town, but no less quality. Both the food and service were impeccable!
Super yummy! Upscale, raw vegan experience! Noting like this in the country!
Loved it! But be ready to spend a lot of money
The best food ever, you should try it!  Service was very good.

I really enjoyed the ambiance and service. With that said, I am now convinced that I simply live cooked food....I find raw very difficult to enjoy.  This place defitnily packages raw...vegan and fine dine nicely.

I have to say the experience, the decor and the food was amazing. Dora and Elizabeth and her team made everything so special and so pleasant and wonderful. The kale chips are so so delicious that you want to work in the kitchen and research their process. It's the first fine dinning vegan restaurant I've been too as I'm what you call a a meat eater. So you can say I was incredibly impressed by the taste and everything. Oh and don't let me start on their drink selections. I sticked with their cocktail choices and each cocktail is a delight and can I say very fresh and smooth. I rarely write reviews but I had too. Elizabeth I think I've found my favorite DC restaurant!
Awesome at every aspect of our dinning experience!

We are visiting from CA from the weekend and I botched our reservations, I accidentally made them for the week after we were in town. I didn’t even realize until they tried to check us in and couldn’t find us. They graciously squeezed us and and provided the best service!  The food was fantastic and creative!  I have found sometimes at gourmet or fine dinning the food is just plain weird and unapproachable. After 7 courses I was FULL, impressed and satisfied!  We will definitely be back on our next visit!
Absolutely amazing gourmet experience.  Great ambience, sommelier available to come to your table, all around five star quality food and service.

Fascinating food, made with restrictions on material and cooking temperature. It's great to have such a focused and inventive vegan restaurant, but the mandatory tasting menu was very expensive and felt repetitive when we went. While the food is "raw" in terms of temperature restrictions, it has often been heavily modified through chemical processes of molecular gastronomy.  The ingredients often felt much more extensively changed than they would be if just heated up slightly more (they do use heat, but not past a specific mark) and not treated through assorted chemical reactions.
I wish i could eat here every day.  the food was absolutely amazing and worth every penny.  The wine was awesome too and the wine specialist was extremely knowledgable.
Great vegetarian & vegan food. I could not even tell the food was raw. Reservations are hard to come by as you can only dine there several days a month. The food is very creative & tasty.

Simply wonderful, thoughtful cuisine served in a theatrical way. Enjoy seasonal, raw, gourmet vegan seven course meals and feel like royalty for a night. Be prepared to spend upwards of $150 a head, especially if you decide on a wine pairing.
Loved it! Great food and very friendly stuff.
Beautiful setting, Instagram worthy, delicious, sophisticated, attention to detail, fabulous service, completely RAW!!

Drinks were good, service attentive - food, terrible. I had to go to Wendy's afterwards. I get it. Small portions - all raw, but this food isn't filling and doesn't satisfy. And btw, very expensive to boot.

Meal still in progress, 4 courses down and 3 to go. Absolutely stunning. Each course is just a few mouthfuls, beautifully presented and an absolute riot of rich flavors. It is hard to believe that raw  food could taste this good. The service is also fantastic.  We are a group of 5. Each course is being brought out by 5 waiters and set down simultaneously for each of us. We feel like we are part of a performance piece.
The food is awesome and pretty amazing
Romantic, exquisite foods, fantastic service!

This was the worst dinner I have probably ever had at a restaurant.  It is vegan and raw which is great, but tastes horrendous.  The meal swung like a pendulum between bland and offensive - soup over flavored with fennel, inedible salty turmeric sorbet.  Dessert was good, the 6 prior courses were unimpressive at best.  We were wow-ed by nothing.
Beautiful and tasty creations! Once in a lifetime experience.
Elizabeth Gone Raw is an EXPERENCE! This is not just eating out or having dinner. Be prepared to be blown away! This is a Vegan’s paradise.
Fun dinner, unique/ great wine pairing - perfect for a special occasion
Very interesting but possibly a bit overpriced.

Definitely a unique experience. The house itself is gorgeous. The downstairs area is a bar and the main dining room is upstairs. Cocktails are excellent. The food was above average but didn't blow me away. A wide range of techniques were put on display, and each dish had a wide range of components. Overall, the meal was well progressed and I left feeling satisfied and full. Within each dish, there were individual components that I would not have wanted to eat again. However, a spoon containing all these components was always excellent and surprising.
Fantastic food, service and atmosphere. We always love dining here a great place to celebrate a special occasion or for the perfect date night.
Absolutely amazing place. I am a meat eater, and had certain expectations about a vegan meal. The food here was absolutely delicious. Fantastic!
OMG!

Elizabeth's is not your typical dining experience. Remember - the food is all vegan and not cooked. The limitations on traditional 'food' are tremendous and it is an absolute delight to see what can be created under these circumstances. The food was simply beautiful. The service was the best I have ever had in the city. I'm a harsh critic of service and the staff and Elizabeth herself, made the experience memorable.  The individual plates are works of art - in many cases, unique. Those used to heated, cooked meals need to leave expectations at the door and enter a new world. It is a world not unlike Willy Wonka's where the next plate is a total surprise.  My husband eats vegan and for him this was minerva. I'm a regular human, as he says, and I was delighted at the surprises presented to me.  Elizabeth's is a magical experience. And worth the wait and cost.  When you look at the meal and ask a few questions, you understand the amount of creativity and preparation that goes into each item, the love of the quest to create within constraints, the ability to extract the best from ingredients.  If you cannot check traditional expectations at the door, Elizabeth's may not be for you, but if you are willing to enter Willy Wonka's world, step inside Elizabeth's kitchen.

One of my favorite places in DC. Great place to come if you're celebrating a special occasion (and they're only open on Fridays!). Service is friendly and casual - which is nice because a lot of high-end places tend to be too reserved and haughty.  The food is excellent! Very inventive. The menu changes every month. I had the sweet potato gnocchi - which had sort of an Asian, sesame flavor - and it was GREAT!

The food tasted okay but sorry I've had much better. Too much nutritional yeast for starters. Vegan can taste phenomenal but this place goes overboard in trying to make it more appealing and you end up with overdone food. The service was good and surroundings nice but the food didn't meet our expectations the prices are very very high for what you get. Not sure what we even spent it on for our $250.00 bill. I think we could have eaten in the finest restaurant in D.C. for less than this. Not sure where all the 5 star reviews came from because it wasn't that special. In fact it was a disappointment.

Best restaurant I've ever been too.  Very unique and in a beautiful setting.  I have no clue how people have given it anything but 5 stars.  I think some meat eaters expect everything to be loaded with fat and salt.  I've been vegan for 5 years and can say id go back to DC just for this restaurant!  I wish they'd open up more restaurants similar to this elsewhere!
Amazing food! Loved the kale chips. The service was beyond exceptional.
Kind, warmest and Tasty! Creative cuisine!
Fun vegetarian tasting experience!

Finally got to try Elizabeth's Gone Raw this last Friday and it did not disappoint at all.  Great pacing on the tasting courses. It never felt rushed. We just sat back and enjoyed the experience. All of the flavors were balanced so well and the dishes were beautifully plated.  Cocktails were delicious and balanced as well.  Can't wait to return.

The food here is excellent - all vegan and nothing prepared over a certain temperature (which means no coffee as the beans require roasting). But this isn't without flavor. Red peppers are dried out instead of roasted to concentrate their flavor. I recommend this as a rare treat - whoever put the two dollar signs up is crazy. The three of us cost more than $400 to eat here with tax and tip.

My wife and I had the tasting menu. She is a vegetarian and I'm not, but we eat vegetarian meals regularly so I was excited to try this place because of all the wonderful reviews.  The Good: The decor was really nice and the service was truly excellent, which made the food all the more disappointing.  The Bad: This was hands-down the worst meal I have ever had in this city. And I've lived in the District for 14 years. The salad of lima beans and fava beans tasted like dirt, the sauces did nothing to help mask it. The main course--a polenta dish--was gummy and paste-like and tasted awful.  The Ugly: And it was not cheap. We ordered the tasting menu and one of the least expensive bottles of wine and the bill came to $250 (including tip). I know taste is subjective, but we both left extremely disappointed. I'm not sure how anyone could really enjoy this food.
Good

First vegan restaurant experience!  Elizabeth Petty, the founder and owner, started Elizabeth's Gone Raw, the vegan restaurant that's only open Friday nights and offers a six course tasting menu, as well as a catering company. Elizabeth's on L is their private venue that Ms. Petty bought 11 years ago (formerly a federalist townhouse) and renovated into a gorgeous, open space that comfortably seats up to 90 guests. They also cater off-site.  I came here for a work lunch to discuss renewable energy and green initiatives. Elizabeth's on L was the perfect venue for this roundtable discussion. Everyone mingled downstairs while the staff set up upstairs. Once they were done setting up, we were taken upstairs where in the main area, there was a long table for us to dine at. There was also another waiting/mingling area that faced the street, enough for all of us to stand and talk. The table was set up with immaculate place settings and decorated with fresh flowers in the center.  After we all sat down, staff members bought out both sweetened and unsweetened ice tea and then the first course. Elizabeth Petty was there to give a brief introduction into Elizabeth's on L and Elizabeth's Gone Raw. Another staff member talked about what the appetizer was before we started eating and going into our discussion.  The three courses were: + Beet and apple ravioli with macadamia nut ricotta and fennel foam + Green papaya risotto with wild mushrooms, asparagus, and nut parmesan + Strawberry cake with banana buttercream  My favorite was probably the beet and apple ravioli. I think it had the most complexity in terms of flavors. Staff would replenish waters and teas quickly and take our empty dishes and silverware and replace with new courses efficiently. All staff members were highly professional and friendly. We had a guest speaker present for most of the lunch, but the staff moved around discreetly and skillfully while still switching out courses. At the end of our guest speaker's presentation, the staff discussed the other courses we ate.  This venue does not charge a booking fee, so if you're looking for a cozy and chic place to hold a dinner party, cocktail hour, professional forums, or even a wedding reception, you should definitely consider this space. The space is decorated with paintings, rugs, and even a fireplace.

I was there to visit an organization who conducts a breakfast meeting there on Wednesdays. I met Elizabeth and had the opportunity to taste the food.  From the Food  to the decor, everything about this restaurant was nice!  Although it is very centrally located, its design makes it appear as if it was somewhat hidden away. The building hides in plain sight and I liked that!
